quests.description: By order of the Royal Palace: The valiant Sir Eglamour has ventured into the wilderness in search of opportunities heroic and valourous. Most distressingly, he has not been seen in three days. A brave adventurer is hereby offered the honour of exploring the wildlands and participating in the undoubtedly mythical adventure in which the Good Sir surely now finds himself. Recompense is guaranteed upon discovery of the Good Sir's... condition.
quests.commencement: find Sir Eglamour in the wildlands. I only hope to find the man-at-arms with arms intact...
quests.completion: After tracking him for many days, I have found Sir Eglamour... at the pub. Apparently, during his adventure he caught sight of a great dragon and immediately discovered a passion for drinking and farming. I shall report my findings and return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: discovered the fate of Sir Eglamour.

quests.description: The Richton Estate has been home to a great deal of turmoil as the family that recently moved in has been contesting the right to be there with the already resident poltergeist. Please send someone capable of resolving the situation.
quests.commencement: travel to the Richton Estate and settle this matter of the problematic poltergeist.
quests.completion: Upon entering the Richton Estate I quickly learned that the poltergeist was none other than Sir Archibald G. Richton, the original owner and architect of the estate. After extracting the last will and testament of the final Richton family member from a neatly stacked pile of furniture, I learned that the sale was against the desire of the Richtons. The new family has been successfully chased away from the house. While MacMaerny Estate Management is most displeased, the ghost has rewarded me for my valor. I return now to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: resolved the spectral dispute at Richton Estate.

quests.description: Some sneaky goblin has been harrassing my farm. I doubt I'll see the chickens again but I would like my tools and other stock back. Please send a good tracker to find the little devil.
quests.commencement: aid this farmer {0} in dispatching the goblin and retrieving the farm supplies. I should be careful; goblins are small and weak, but devilishly tricky...
quests.completion: I found the goblin's lair and approached under cover of daylight (for, as everyone knows, goblins abhor the light of the sun). I found the farmer's tools and those livestock that yet lived. The goblin awoke quite suddenly and beset me with poison darts. With a swing of my blade I split the conniving creature's skull before its darts had a chance to find their mark. I have returned the farmer's goods, and now make my way back to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: retrieved the farmer's supplies from the goblin menace.

quests.description: I've got just a terrible infestation of rodents in my cellar! Please, won't a kind young soul come to my farmstead and help me be rid of them? They say it's the best way to start your career as an Adventurer!
quests.commencement: deal with the rat infestation in Widow Hargrave's cellar. This seems a trivial matter, but I am happy to help the dear old lady. Adventure awaits!
quests.completion: Upon arriving at the widow's cellar, I found that the house cat had already dealt with several of the rodents. I cleared out the remaining rats, to old Widow Hargrave's delight. All in a day's work as an Adventurer, I suppose. Now it's back to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: assisted Widow Hargrave's cat in his pest control duties.

quests.description: I've lost what's most precious to me in the world! My grand-dad left me a locket when he passed containing a single wilted flower petal from across the sea, likewise left to him by his grand-dad and so on. Itâ€™s not worth much in trade, but is worth everything to my family. A week ago, it up and disappeared! We suspect a traveller who was lollygagging around our shop must have pilfered it. Please, will someone get back my locket?
quests.commencement: track down the thief of the petal locket and bring him to justice. Thence I will return the locket to {0}.
quests.completion: After several days of tracking and questioning other travellers I found the petal locket thief holed up in a cave several miles from town. When I approached he called out jovially, inviting me to sit at his fire. I sat with him and his air of fiendishness made his intent to rob me immediately obvious. After some short conversation he invited me to sleep by the warmth of the fire. I accepted and laid on my bedroll but did not allow sleep to take me. In the dead of night I perceived movement around my belongings and so I struck out into the darkness with my fists and the thief crumpled in an unconscious mass. I bound him and searched his belongings, finding the petal locket therein. After delivering the thief to the authorities I returned the locket and received the reward. I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: retrieved the heirloom from the thief.

quests.description: Our prized sow has gone missing. The town guard laughed in my face when I asked for aid, and so we turn to hired blades. The pig is no mere stock, but the pride of our family. She attracts folk from far and wide with her size and beauty. During their stay they not only pay to see the beast, but purchase my wife's stitchwork and hire my son for labour. 'Tis a bountiful endeavour for us, and now it is lost. Please, find our dear Bumpkin.
quests.commencement: find Bumpkin the Sow and return her to her owners. Surely her thief knows her value and has kept her safe.
quests.completion: I tracked the swine swindlers to an underground livestock trade. Posing as a black market barterer I guiled the whereabouts of Bumpkin the Sow from various traders. Upon finding the enclosure holding the humongous hog I revealed my intentions to the holder. A short scuffle later and I walked out of the market leaving the crook crumpled in unconsciousness behind me. I returned Bumpkin the Sow to the grateful owners and collected the reward. I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: rescued Bumpkin the Sow from certain demise.

quests.description: I seek the aid of an adventurer who is not so proud as to forget us lowly folk. During the village festival last moon, my neighbour and I partook in more than our share of the spirits and lost our wits. Sometime during the night I recall falling into a ditch and losing my lucky rat's foot. Please, if you be willing, search the ditches around town for my rat's foot. You'll know it by its bronzing.
quests.commencement: find this lost rat's foot for Brock the Foul. Surely even a miresome peasant deserves to hold his luck in tact.
quests.completion: After traversing the roadways for several days I found the place where Brock fell into the ditch. It looked akin to a hog wallow and smelled... like Brock. After no short time of digging through the filth I saw within the muck a glint of sunlight. Sure enough it was the bronzed rat's foot. I cleaned myself up as best I could in a nearby pond and returned to collect the reward from the begrimed but grateful Brock. I now head back to the Adventure Guild to clean (or burn) my clothes.
quests.trophyDescription: found the filthy baubel for Brock the Foul.

quests.description: Our village is under an evil siege! Every night a horde of ghouls approaches our walls and bangs on our gates. Last week a poor maid was taking an evening stroll and... Well, we need this dealt with. We've no idea why the monsters are here, but we need them destroyed.
quests.commencement: travel to the town of Dendrey and aid in dispatching this drove of the undead.
quests.completion: The town of Dendrey was hushed upon my arrival, as though everyone were holding their breath. In the waning daylight hours we laid fire traps on the field outside the wall. As the sun disappeared behind the horizon, the first of the ghouls appeared. Slowly the stumbling pack grew into a horde and they were at the walls, stratching and moaning. We sprung our trap with a well-placed fire arrow and the field erupted in flames. The ghouls, barely aware of their own demise, continued scratching and moaning as they shrivelled into dust. We picked off the stragglers and in the morning we cleaned the field of the remains. I stayed one extra night to ensure the ghouls were defeated, and indeed they were. The townspeople gratefully paid the reward, and I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: defended the town of Dendrey from the undead threat.

quests.description: Dear Adventurers, I have made a most grave error! Upon my first trade caravan as a member of the Merchants Guild I was waylaid and forced to abandon my cargo! I wish not to be expelled from the guild and so I beg, please, track down my shipment and retrieve it!
quests.commencement: find the place where Abernathy abandoned her shipment. With any luck it will still be there.
quests.completion: I came upon the location where Abernathy abandoned her shipment. Several wagons were still there, but were completely ransacked. I was able to retrieve only a meagre portion of the original cargo and so returned it to Abernathy. Upon receipt, she immediately drew up a new contract to further investigate the missing cargo and posted it to the Quest Board. I return now to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: retrieved the remains of Merchant Abernathy's shipment.

quests.description: The forest is bereft of wildlife and my family suffers! Hunting is our livelihood, but the beasts have migrated from our woods. Tending to our meagre crop, owed to the lord of our land, keeps us from expeditioning further into the wild, and so we face starvation when winter arrives. Please, we seek an adventurer who will travel deep into the woods and bring us back a bounty of game!
quests.commencement: venture deep into the woods on a hunting expedition. Any game I can capture will help this poor family come winter.
quests.completion: After several days' expedition deep into the forest, I found a spring around which a large assortment of beasts reposed. With great care and finesse I laid claim to one such beast and gathered it up as the others retreated. I returned the game to the hunter and received my reward. I now travel back to the Adventure Guild.

quests.description: By order of the Royal Palace: a bounty has been issued for the capture and return of one Ardogath Robson, wanted for the theft of dinnerware from the servants' quarters of the Royal Palace. Not a particularly threatening bloke, quite slow and gaspy. A meagre reward will be paid upon his return (alive, if you please).
quests.commencement: track down this Ardogath Robson and return him to the Royal Palace. This sounds like a simple enough job, perfect for a beginner in the field of adventuring!
quests.completion: After a few days of asking around town and tracking his rather clumsy movement, I located Ardogath Robson in a rundown inn a mere few streets over from the Palace. He was in the midst of a robbery, emptying his own pockets onto a table for the pair of children who held him at knifepoint. I stepped in and dismissed the children who were wide-eyed and terrified at my appearance. I took Ardogath by the nape of the neck and walked him back to the Royal Palace, where I received my reward and he received the stock. I now return to the Adventure Guild.

quests.description: Greetings, adventurers. I seek one who would carry a valuable belonging of mine to the nearby town of Belmere. A trivial task, no doubt, for professionals of your stature. Please, do not shake the box. And don't mind the growling.
quests.commencement: transport this "valuable belonging" of {0}'s to the town of Belmere. It growls when I shake it, so best not to let fall open at any point.
quests.completion: I arrived at the town of Belmere and delivered the mysterious box to the recipient: the proprietor of a sanctuary of sorts, dedicated to creatures of various kinds. They opened the box immediately, revealing a baby manticore! Grateful not to have succumbed to my curiosity on the road, I left with reward in hand. I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: delivered the mysterious box to the Belmere sanctuary proprietor.

quests.description: Hark adventurers, our town of Belmere seeks a brave soul to root out mischief in our humble midst! The town treasury becomes unduely lightened at the turn of every month, and we plan to entrap the culprit and bring them to justice! A fine reward will await the adventurer who aids us!
quests.commencement: aid the town of Belmere in capturing the culprit who is pilfering their coffers, at the behest of the Mayor.
quests.completion: I arrived in the town of Belmere and met with its treasurer. It became immediately clear that bandits were pilfering gold in the night following each month's tax day, when the coffers were at their fullest. It was a simple matter of watching the coffers that night, and catching the sneakthief in the act. With the culprit caught, I received my reward and now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: captured the treasury bandit in the town of Belmere.

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: Seeking the aid of a brave sir or madam who will not shy away from a brush with the Giants of Rockglen! They have waylaid a merchant caravan, squashing man and mule without remorse. Sad to be sure, but herein lies the real tragedy: our trade wagons have been strewn upon the unreachable cliffsides! The Merchant Guild tasks our valiant sibling Guild of Adventurers with retrieving the goods in short order and marketable condition. Compensation will be provided upon return of the products.
quests.commencement: retrieve the merchants' goods. The Giants of Rockglen will surely put up a fight.
quests.completion: I arrived at the cliff and was immediately attacked by the Giants of Rockglen. After a hair-raising battle with the oversized ruffians I was able to retrieve the merchants' goods. They have been returned to the Merchant Guild and now I return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: retrieved the Merchant Master's goods from the Giants of Rocklen.

quests.description: Thieves ransacked my shop! I went to the town guard to report the crime of course, and they just says to me, they says, "What did the thieves look like?" And I says, "I don't know, it was the middle o' the night and I were asleep!" And they laughed and laughed and sent me away. So here I am, requestin' the aid of a world-wise adventurer who might take pity on me. I don't know how to find these scoundrels, only that they stole an odd selection of items: a feathered cowl, a ceramic egg, and a stuffed crow.
quests.commencement: find the thieves who ransacked {0}'s shop. It is a strange collection of items to be stolen... I wonder why they were taken.
quests.completion: Asking around town and nearby countryside, I learned that several bird-related items had been stolen from various shops in recent nights: a raven's perch, a bag of seeds, and a lucky pidgeon's foot. I decided to watch the nearby aviary for suspicious activity. Sure enough, the very night I arrived I observed a frantic man in tattered clothes constructing a shrine with the stolen goods. I watched him curiously as he lit candles and began a strange chant. The birds of the aviary awoke and began swirling through the air as one to the lilt of the chant. I decided it was time to end this. I crept out and hit him over the head. In that moment the birds scattered and returned to their nests and perches. I turned the madman in to the authorities and returned the stolen goods. I now return to the Adventure Guild, none the more informed as to what exactly I witnessed...

quests.description: My daughter has been taken captive by some brutish bandits! They demanded a ransom that cost me half my life's savings, but I paid it all the same. Yet they refuse to return her and demand even more money! I beg, seek out these bandits and end them. Then bring my daughter home!
quests.commencement: find these bandits and rescue the daughter held captive. Perhaps I can return the poor farmer's ransom money in the process.
quests.completion: I found the bandits hiding out in an abandoned farmstead. The girl was bound to the horse post outside, tired and malnourished. As I approached the bandits beset me, flailing blade and blunt in an amateurish show of force. I deftly dispatched two of the larger ones and the rest fled. I untied the girl and found her family's ransom money inside the house. Having returned both to the farmer and received a reward, I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: rescued the farmer's daughter from the unscrupulous bandits.

quests.description: By order of the Royal Palace: I seek an adventurer who will aid us in clearing out an infestation of giant bats from the battlements of the citadel. These creatures are not the average bat seen about the countryside. They are large... very large. And hungry for blood, it seems. I've lost two recruits on what I thought was a mundane maintenance task, and I've no interest in risking any more of my men. Payment will be awarded upon inspection of the cleared battlements.
quests.commencement: aid the Guard Captain in clearing out the infestation of giant bats in the citadel battlements. I must be doubly careful, not only of the bats' bite, but of the battlement's height.
quests.completion: I have successfully aided in eradicating the giant bats infesting the citadel battlements. They were surely the largest bats I've seen within the city limits, and their taste for blood was fierce. However between myself, Guard Captain Helrick and several soldiers we cleared the colony. I now return to the Adventure Guild, the Palace's reward in hand.
quests.trophyDescription: cleared the giant bats out of the citadel.

quests.description: The earth within the graveyard has been unsettled of late. A gods-fearin' man such as myself holds no interest in explorin' what dark underhappenin's may cause such a ruckus, and so I reach out to an adventurer. Prepare ye to face all manner of nightly terrors as ye take up this task. Undead wanderers, perhaps? Vampires pale? The depraved dead-devourers seeking sightlessly their next victuous victim? I know not, and charge ye to investigate.
quests.commencement: discover (and thence lay to rest) whatever disturbs the graveyard in the night. I am prepared for what unholy ghouls may lay in my path, though admittedly apprehensive.
quests.completion: I waited in the graveyard two nights, observing the silent stones and statues as they stood in unwatching guard over the dead below. On the third night I heard the noise of disturbance in the earth some distance away. Upon investigation I found the cause of the unearthed graves: robbers. The filth-ridden crooks were ransacking the recently deceased for gold and jewels. I charged them head-on and in their surprise they did little to respond. With the butt of my blade I rendered them all unconscious and bound them. It is not for me to decide their fate; they have been left to the will (or whim) of the judiciary. I found the graveyard keeper afterward and collected my reward. I now return to the Adventure Guild, in need of a hot bath.
quests.trophyDescription: uncovered the cause of the unearthed graves.

quests.description: We are reaching out to the Adventure Guild for aid in retrieving a minor relic. During a routine relocation incantation an acolyte managed to transport a small focus stone onto the roof of the temple in Talwick. How the young mage accomplished such a precise act of failure is beyond me. Normally we would easily retrieve the stone ourselves but certain parts of the temple are protected against magic so we must retrieve it the "old-fashioned" way. We need someone with an aptitude for risking life and limb for meagre payment, so here we are.
quests.commencement: travel to the temple in question and retrieve the focus stone. Falling from the rooftop is no concern of mine... hitting the ground is though.
quests.completion: I arrived at the temple in the village of Talwick. The temple rooftop was a steep and precarious pitch. To make matters worse, rain began to fall just as I arrived. Nevertheless I scaled the walls and clambered up the slippery rooftop slates. Between the shoulders of an overhanging gargoyle I found the focus stone glimmering softly. As I tucked the stone into my pouch I felt my grip on the rain-swept stone give way. I fell. Sliding down stone and then falling through air, I felt the cold wind and saw the ground quickly approaching. In the final moment I became weightless and floated to the earth like a feather. Conjurer Aritax stood before me, shaking his head in disdain. "You're lucky I've compassion," he said to me. "I could easily have benefitted from your services for free just now." I thanked him and departed with the reward. The Mage's Guild is a strange, unkind place. I return now to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: retrieved the Mage's relic from the heights of Talwick.

quests.description: I beg the aid of an adventurer once more. My cargo was discovered to have been ransacked by bandits, and only a small portion was recovered. I must retrieve the rest of the shipment if I wish not to lose my place in the Merchants Guild! Please, set out to the location of the caravan and track the bandits who stole the shipment. Return the goods to me and do as you please with the villains!
quests.commencement: return to the location of the trade caravan and pick up the bandits' trail. Once the merchandise is safe, Abernathy's place in the guild is sure to be secure.
quests.completion: The bandits left an obvious trail from the ransacked caravan and were not hard to track. I followed them to a hideout in the forest. Sure enough, the merchandise was laid out upon the ground amidst tents and firepits. Counting over twenty ne'er-do-wells, I knew a direct attack was unwise. I lit a fire some distance away which attracted the greedy attention of the bandits. Only five remained to guard the camp, whom I dispatched with ease. Loading the cargo onto one of the bandit's wagons, I returned it to Abernathy at the Merchants Guild. Reward in hand, I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: beguiled the bandits and retrieved Abernathy's shipment.

quests.description: Adventurers, the Town of Belmere is once again in need of your aid! After your deft handling of our treasury thief, I have no doubt the Guild will come through for us again! You see, the treasury thief's band of ne'er-do-wells has threatened to break their foolish friend out of prison if we do not submit a payment of ransom immediately! Please, uncover the whereabouts of these miscreants and bring them to equal justice as their incarcerated comrade!
quests.commencement: discover the whereabouts of the bandit gang who seeks to break their brethren out of the Belmere prison.
quests.completion: Belmere was on edge when I arrived. They are ill prepared for the arrival of a bandit gang, and so I set to work immediately to find the gang first. After following the clues and information provided by the townspeople, I discovered the bandits in a cave nearby. Sure enough, they were gathered around a fire planning their siege of the Belmere. It was a simple matter of dislodging a large boulder above the cave entrance, and the bandit gang is no longer a threat. I led the authorities to their location to ensure their prison be one of brick and not boulder, and I now return to the Adventure Guild, reward in hand.

quests.description: Many of the other villagers and I have noticed an increase of goblin activity in the foothills. I would like to place a magical beacon on the mountaintop southwest of town which will help me triangulate from whence the goblins originate. I am a simple mage, however, no fighter. I would not survive an encounter with the beasts. And so I ask that an adventurer accept this contract to venture out in my place. Simply install the provided beacon at the highest point on the nearby mountain. I will know you have succeeded when my enchantments begin to work, and will then be prepared with your reward.
quests.commencement: install {0}'s magical beacon on the nearby mountaintop in order to monitor the goblin activity.
quests.completion: The foothills were, indeed, swarming with an unusual quantity of goblins. As it was nearly dawn, I waited for the sun to rise and the goblins to retreat to their subterranean lairs before approaching the mountain. With some small difficulty I climbed the rocky terrain while fighting off the odd straggling goblin, but soon enough I found myself at the summit. I took out the mage's beacon and installed it as instructed. Sure enough, it immediately began radiating a deep, blue light and a low humming sound. Upon returning to town (dispatching one or two more goblins along the way), {} met me and gladly paid the reward. I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: braved the goblin-infested foothills to install the mountaintop beacon.

quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description:
help
I'm sorry
I dont want to die
Falrich's Cove
quests.commencement: find this person who appears to be in grave danger. I only hope I am not too late...
quests.completion:
I have followed the mysterious stranger to Falrich's Cove. The site upon which I stumbled was... strange. A meagre stash of treasures and another note:

"My friend, they have found me. I fear it is too late. I beg you, do not let them take the amulet. Keep it safe."

I do not know who wrote the letter, or to whom it is intended. I found nearby a stash of goods including a strange amulet, no doubt the one mentioned in the note. I collected the goods and the amulet, and now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: investigated Falrich's Cove at the behest of a strange note.

quests.description: Eerie sounds have been coming from the lighthouse at Falrich's Cove of late, and now it has gone dark! If there be an adventurer willing to make the journey, investigate the tower and relight the beacon. Many a ship will run asunder on the rocks, and many lives will be lost if the light remains snuffed. Though we be mere peasants of the countryside, we have gathered a reward amongst ourselves for the one who carries out this task.
quests.commencement: investigate the dark lighthouse at Falrich's Cove and relight the beacon.
quests.completion: The lighthouse at Falrich's Cove was dark and lifeless, save for a strange drone emanating from within. I silently made my way inside and found a rough, earthen basement dug out of the floor, from whence the sound of chanting came. As I crouched, listening, I noticed a small manifesto left near the burrow entrance. A cult, intent on crashing ships upon the rocks and using the remains in their vile rituals, were at work here. They had to be stopped, and so I lowered myself into the cavern to confront them. Inside I found a dozen robed chanters around a black pedestal upon which a silver chalice rested, the contents of which I dared not consider. The floor was covered in the vile runes of dark magic, scribbled with chalk. I pounced upon them with the element of surprise! The chalice toppled and spilled over one cultist, and he was instantly dispatched by its sordid contents. The rest fumbled for crude weapons as I incapacitated one after another. Finally there remained only four robed chanters standing against me. They came at me together, but their fighting technique was clumsy. I left them unconscious on the ground, and ascended the lighthouse. At the top I struck a spark upon my blade and reignited the flame. A group of villagers met me as I returned to the ground, and gratefully paid me the reward. I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: relit the lighthouse beacon at Falrich's Cove.

quests.description: Mamortorr seeks adventurers to participate in the training of our novices, preparing them for inevitable combat scenarios. This area is not safe from thieves and bandits so even foraging for herbal reagents may require battle-readiness. Meet the mages at the Mamortorr training field as soon as possible.
quests.commencement: to meet the mages of Mamortorr and aid in training them for combat. I believe it is a worthwhile endeavour to build strong bonds with our sibling Guild.
quests.completion: I arrived at the Mamortorr training field and immediately was immediately met by smiling old mage surrounded by three chatting students. He explained that we would form two-person teams. It quickly became apparent that the synergy between mage and warrior imparted advantage over two mages. The students took turns joining me in sparring against the others and we all gained experience in our teamwork. Waeterhond provided my dues and I returned to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: assisted in training the mages of Mamortorr.

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: A horde of displaced thieves and murderers have set up camp around the main road leading to our town. Our lord protector has not dealt with the situation himself, nor is he allowing any lenience in taxation that we may pay to have the situation dealt with. Please, we ask the Adventure Guild to send someone to deal with these miscreants!
quests.commencement: deal with these ne'er-do-wells who harass the poor folk of this area. If the lord protector cannot be relied upon, then let us of the Adventure Guild take up the challenge!
quests.completion: I found the bandit camp at night, the raucous group hardly a challenge to track. Before I could devise a plan I was captured by the watch! Face to face with the bandit leader, I knew I had only one chance. I challenged him to a duel. He accepted, and we drew swords. We fought through the night, his dastardly men shouting and cheering all the while. As the sun peaked over the eastern hills, the bandit leader revealed a moment of weakness and I struck. He fell, his face marked eternally with an expression of shock. His band of brutes scattered immediately and in their confusion ran directly into a patrol passing on the nearby highway. I reported the defeat of the bandit gang to the villagers and received my reward. I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: duelled the bandit leader for the protection of Herencaester.

quests.description: By order of the Royal Palace: An adventurer both daring and discreet is needed to find an item of great importance to the Young Prince. During his daily walk about the ramparts, the Prince dropped a toy horse over the edge which fell among the rocks below. We were unable to retrieve it and fear it has fallen through the crevases into the caverns below. The adventurer who takes this charge will be duly rewarded under the condition that they tell no one what they see in the caverns.
quests.commencement: find the Young Prince's lost toy horse. Surely this is a paltry task; what dangers could possibly lurk in under the very roots of the Royal Palace?
quests.completion: I explored the rocks at the base of the ramparts and did indeed find crevases which opened into deep caverns below. I made my way within and found... Darkness. Not that which is expected in the subterrain, but an inky blackness that my torch could not dispel. I heard shuffling in the darkness, moans and shrieks in the distance below. Everyone few minutes I heard the distinct wavering blast of magic echoing from the depths. Each moment spent within the caverns filled me further with foreboding. I know not what sordid deeds are unfolding beneath the belly of the Royal Palace, but for now I wish not to find out. I discovered the toy horse after some time of searching amongst the rocks and rubble and departed presently. The reward was paid by the Guard Captain and I return now to the Adventure Guild.

quests.description: Disaster! My dear Adventure Guild, the gang of bandits that saught to besiege our town of Belmere has escaped! We now hear rumours of a number of different bandit groups joining forces against us! Please, we beg you... return to Belmere once again and help us prepare for this inevitable onslaught!
quests.commencement: aid the town of Belmere in its preparations for the bandit onslaught!
quests.completion: The town of Belmere erected palisades to protect against the bandit threat. I instructed in their construction as I've seen it done countless times in my own adventures. I then took to training the people in the ways of combat. Pitchforks, shovels, spears and bows were utilized in order to give the peasants the best chance of survival. With all preparations complete, the Mayor's confidence in the town's chances has increased. He has released me from the contract and provided the agreed upon reward. I now return to the Adventure Guild, not without concern for the fate of Belmere...
quests.trophyDescription: trained the townspeople of Belmere to fight against the bandit threat.

quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: Our village has been infected by some foul disease and we seek aid in finding the source. Our priest believes us to be cursed while the healer suspects something more mundane. Please, come to the village of Talwick and investigate this sickness!
quests.commencement: to find the cause of the sickness in the village of Talwick. Be it magic or malady I will get to the bottom of it and save the villagers.
quests.completion: I arrived at the village of Talwick and was greeted by the stench of sickness. I set immediately to investigating. The food supply was secure and clean, a nearby sorceror was conducting some experiments but nothing dastardly. Finally, I checked the well from whence the villagers draw their water. A foulness hung within that depth, and so I spelunked down inside with a torch. At the bottom I found a crude charm. I removed the charm and within the day the water had cleared and the stench was gone. Upon questioning the healer he became agitated and struck out at me. I restrained him and turn him over to the village counsel to do as they will. What will a man not do to profit off of those around him? In any case, I return now to the Adventure Guild, reward in hand.
quests.trophyDescription: discovered the cause of the plague of Talwick.

quests.description: Our village is under siege! Not by raiders or bandits, or by a tyrannical lord. No, 'tis a gryphon that harasses us! We beg of thee, send a brave adventurer who might dispatch this great terror and bring us peace and safety! You will find our village of Crast in the South, beyond the river.
quests.commencement: dispatch a gryphon. They say it has the body of a great lion with the head and wings and piercing talons of an eagle. This is surely a harrowing test of skill and strength requiring no small amount of preparation.
quests.completion:
The village of Crast was in shambles under the gryphon's torment. I arrived near dawn and saw rubble and wreckage strewn about the streets and alleys where homes and shops once stood. The people were hiding in the village hall, silently awaiting their fate. I waited at the palisade for the gryphon's return. After only a few hours I heard the dread cry of the beast. I saw it soon thereafter, flying in the sky, approaching from the west.

First it struck an empty building destroying it like dried twigs. Then it came to the ground and began searching for the villagers. I took my opportunity to strike. With a deft swing of blade, I wounded its left wing. It cried out and struck back, knocking me clear across the street. Back and forth our duel tipped, for hours upon hours.

As the sun began to set I lit a torch that I might continue to fight in the dark. Therein I realized my opportunity for victory. As the gryphon lunged I stepped deftly to the side and struck out with the torch, connecting with the beast's eye and blinding it. In its rage and without proper sight it lunged clumsily. My blade struck true. The beast thrashed and stumbled, collapsing upon the peaks of the palisade.

The villagers came forth from the hall cheering and praising the mighty feat. Ealdorman Westnedge embraced me before handing me the reward for the contract. With the villagers of Crast now safe and payment in hand, I return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: defended the village of Crast from the gryphon.

quests.description: We, the Gnomes of Schmutzbund, require ingredients from a nearby wizard. Unfortunately, the wizard's ingredients are not for sale and he is ill receptive to the living. We do have, however, a collection of treasures to trade with any brave and enterprising adventurer who might acquire the goods from the dark wizard of the woods.
quests.commencement: to find this dark wizard of the woods and reason with him. Surely even a dark wizard has need of something for which I could barter the ingredients.
quests.completion: The very air of the forest was subdued as I neared the dark wizard's cave. I entered the silent, inky black passage and emerged in a narrow hall, ornate pedestals standing at either end. Upon each sat a skull atop a tome of undecipherable scribblings. A grey figure appeared before me, not standing but suspended as a man-sized puppet. Seeming at first to be dead, its eyes suddenly sprung open in rage and two imps of the wizard attacked! I fought off the imps, finally lunging forth to bury my blade in the heart of the dark wizard. In a panic the imps disappeared into a magic circle, presumably returning to the plane from whence they came. The lair was silent once more, but calm and peaceful. I collected the ingredients for the gnomes and completed my quest. I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: collected the ingredients from the dark wizard of the woods.

quests.description: I understand that the Adventure Guild has come into possession of an amulet. It is a family heirloom of mine, not worth anything at all but for its sentimental value. I ask that you come to the town of Dendrey and return it to me. A reward will be paid for your service.
quests.commencement: The mystery of the amulet deepens. I shall travel to Dendrey and meet this stranger. Perhaps I will learn more about the amulet at this meeting...
quests.completion: I arrived in the town of Dendrey and made for the town square. I quickly realized I was being followed and watched by several people throughout the crowd. Turning down a quiet alley I waited for one to approach, and grabbed them. I interrogated them, learning that I was to be assassinated upon turning over the amulet to the mysterious contractor. After incapacitating the thug, I made to leave town by back alleys. Unexpectedly, I was pulled into a small shop. The proprietor warned me that the amulet I carried was of grave importance, and must be protected at all costs. He paid me for my troubles and sent me on my way with some fresh supplies. I now return to the Adventure Guild, unsure of what to do with this strange amulet.
quests.trophyDescription: learned more about the strange amulet in the town of Dendrey.

quests.description: Begging the aid of the Adventure Guild once more. I write now under cover of darkness as the bandits who threatened the town of Belmere have sacked us! They run rampant in the streets as the townspeople cower in their cellars. Please, return to Belmere and put an end to this terror!
quests.commencement: rid the town of Belmere of this bandit threat... once and for all.
quests.completion: The townspeople of Belmere fought bravely against the bandits. Once I arrived they were emboldened and followed me into the fray. The bandits were many, numbering near a hundred, but the townspeople were resolute in their intent to be rid of the miscreants. After several hours of skirmishes in the streets wielding pitchfork, shovel, spear and bow, the townspeople finally pressed the bandits into submission. The remaining foes were arrested and escorted immediately to the deepest, darkest cells in the land. The town of Belmere is saved. I have received my reward from the grateful townspeople, and now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: was victorious against the bandit onslaught at the Battle of Belmere.

quests.description: The Port of Parilac has been seized by pirates! They have closed the roads and blocked the nearby passes, and now use the port as their own hub of illicit operations. Ships laden with ill-gotten goods pass through daily, and our own ships are waylaid if they pass too close. We are a conglemoration of independent merchants and tradespeople who have refused to join the Merchant's Guild, and so they do not help us now. We have collected a reward for the one who manages to clear out the pirates. Please, help us!
quests.commencement: clear the pirates out of the Port of Parilac. The way must be clear for the honest folks to ply their trade in peace.
quests.completion: The Port of Parilac was locked down tightly by the pirate forces. Roadblocks and patrols covered every path, and so I had to approach with stealth. I learned quickly that a core group of corsairs were running the operation, screaming orders at the rest who subserviently obeyed. This band of a dozen leaders were in the captain's cabin of the largest ship in the port, a great vessel with red and black sails. I slipped silently into the water and approached unnoticed. Once onboard, I found several barrels of grog, which by its smell was likely both potent and flamable. I quietly tipped the barrels over, allowing the liquid to spill over the deck. Once I deemed it sufficient, I took a torch from a nearby bracket and lit the grog. The flame spread immediately, tracking along the spilled grog and then quickly spreading to the lower sails. The pirate leaders roared with rage when they saw the ship burning. They burst from the cabin, swords drawn, but the damage was done. The other pirates, seeing their leaders' ship burning, began to flee. I leapt from the deck and swam back to shore, watching as the pirate leaders futilely attempted to douse the flames. With the brunt of the pirate force now departed, I sped back to a nearby guard outpost and rallied assistance. Returning to the burning ship we found the pirate leaders sprawled on the dock, exhausted, their ship still in flames. The guards arrested the corsairs who were now too tired to put up a fight. I met with {0} at the guard outpost and received the reward. I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: cleared the pirates out of the Port of Parilac.

quests.description: QUEST_DESCRIPTION
quests.commencement: COMMENCE_QUEST
quests.completion: COMPLETE_QUEST

quests.description: I am Aethelric II, Child Prince of the Kingdom of Calan. I admit it unusual for the Throne to reach out directly in this way, but I've not other option. The Adventure Guild has proven its strength time and again in service of the kingdom, and it is in that reputation that I now must trust. A dragon has breached the outskirts of our territory and makes flight toward this very city. Villages and farmsteads are left burned in its path. None can stop it. I beseech the greatest adventurers in our kingdom to stop the dragon!
quests.commencement: face the dragon that burns the kingdom and threatens the destruction of our capitol. The beast will be airborne, so I have equipped a grappling hook. This will be my greatest challenge of all.
quests.completion: Never in my life have I felt such terror! The air was hot and the wind full of ash, a herald of the approaching storm of fire and destruction. I scaled the cliffside and watched as the great dragon approached. Its wings were like the sails of a monstrous skyborne ship, filling fore and back with wind as the beast beat its great limbs upward and down. Like a river of flame the monster spewed forth its destruction upon the land, blasting back and forth an inferno that consumed farmlands, roadways, and any structures therein. As it approached I readied my grappling hook and hid from sight. It passed near the cliff and the wind from its wings was nearly unbearable, hot and wreaking of sulfur. In that moment I sprang forth and leapt from the cliff, swinging the grapple in a wide arc. I threw it and, as I began to fall toward the earth, felt the line grow taut; it had latched onto the dragon's back! I climbed the line, mounted the dragon and began striking it with my blade. It cried out in anger with a deafening screech rolling in the air in an attempt to throw me. The grapple still lodged in its back, I tied the rope tightly around my waist so as not to be removed, and continued my onslaught. I struck the wings and the beast began to drift to the left and right, unsteady in the air. I ventured to crawl forward toward the creature's head, and landed a blow to its left eye, rendering it useless forevermore. The beast wailed, rolled once more, and fell to the earth with a thunderous crash./n/nI removed myself from the grapple and leapt away just as the beast rolled over and over in an attempt to crush its assailant. I dodged and hid with all the stealth I could muster as the dragon once again spewed a torrent of conflagration, craning back and forth to find me. Finally it spotted me; its eyes were rubies of focused rage, its lips curled to reveal rows of dagger-like teeth. With the speed of a snake the dragon lunged forth, and I was not fast enough to evade. In an instant I felt great jaws close around me, a rough slithering tongue below, forcing me toward the abyss. With a final burst of strength I plunged my sword upward and felt it sink deep into the roof of the monster's mouth. It screamed and heat began to build in that darkness; I had mere moments to end this. I withdrew the blade and struck again, and again. A dozen times I withdrew and struck again, each time deepening the gouge in the roof of the beast's mouth. Finally, it opened its mouth for a final blast of flame and I leapt free, pulling my sword out with me. The dragon spewed forth its river of flame, but my plan had worked. Flame spilled forth not only from its mouth now, but from its nose and eyes. It screamed in agony as the cavities of its skull filled with its own conflagration and burned the monster from the inside. With a final cry the dragon fell, the earth shuddering with the impact. There it lay silent, and cold evermore./n/nI returned to the Child Prince with a trophy of the dragon. With the Kingdom of Calan indebted to us and the Prince Aethelric II an eternal ally, I now return to the Adventure Guild.
quests.trophyDescription: aided the Child Prince in thwarting the fiery threat against the Kingdom of Calan.
